result.name: VSFTPD 2.3.4 Backdoor
result.description: VSFTPD 2.3.4 contains a malicious backdoor that grants remote root access.
result.solution: Remove the vulnerable package and replace with a patched version. Reimage host if compromise suspected.

result.name: OpenSSH Remote Code Execution
result.description: OpenSSH version installed is vulnerable to remote code execution allowing attackers to execute arbitrary commands.
result.solution: Upgrade OpenSSH to a non-vulnerable release, rotate keys, and restrict access via firewall rules.

result.name: Unencrypted FTP Login
result.description: FTP is transmitting credentials in plaintext which can be intercepted by network attackers.
result.solution: Migrate to SFTP/FTPS and disable legacy FTP service.

result.name: Apache Directory Traversal
result.description: Apache server allows directory traversal enabling disclosure of system files.
result.solution: Apply vendor patches and validate web application input handling; restrict file system permissions.

result.name: SMB Signing Not Required
result.description: SMB signing is not required, allowing man-in-the-middle attacks on SMB sessions.
result.solution: Enable SMB signing and apply security policies on file server.

result.name: Weak SMB Credentials
result.description: SMB shares use weak passwords allowing brute-force access to sensitive shares.
result.solution: Enforce strong passwords and implement account lockout policies.
